text.headline: Oops Timeline
text.text:
Statements, laws enacted, executive orders, rulings,
and policy decisions that may have been regretted ☞

text.headline: Claim: US Declines offer to expand N95 manufacture
text.text: "January [2020], Department of Health and Human Services officials effectively dismissed an offer from one of America’s few remaining N95 manufacturers, Prestige Ameritech, to expand its production lines". New York Times article via @AbraarKaran

text.headline: IATA medical adviser : "Forget Masks"
text.text: International Air Transport Association has a physician as a medical advisor, David Powell. He gave a video interview for Bloomberg and suggested that masks did a "better job of spreading bugs than preventing them". By May 5th, Powell would promote mask use on board planes

text.headline: Instruction: US citizens should stop buying masks as they are "not effective"
text.text: The tweet has been deleted now, but Surgeon General Jerome Adams, claimed that masks were ineffective. A month later he showed the world how to make masks from T-Shirts. When Joe Biden became the 46th president, Adams was asked to hand in his resignation. Adams hasn't accouted for what happened in February leading up to that regrettable statement
